Text.Value: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.
*A great heat roars through you; her heat, fiery as the Hells.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: OSatterley: [REUSE] MindMeld_03 animation for KARLACH and WYLL
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

Text.Value: Oh boy, an arsehole! I've already won the Blade of Frontiers over; hope you'll prove more of a challenge.
She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...

EditorData.NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

Text.Value: It's an honour to end the fucker who killed all those people - all those innocent people. You monster.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

Text.Value: Don't worry, I'll lead the charge. But I could use your help. There's a lot of them and only one of me. After that, we can team up. Take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?
You want to just team up with some blood-stained killer? Because I'm fine with that.
She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.

EditorData.NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

Text.Value: Be practical. She's infected, same as us - and powerful, too. We can use her as an ally.
A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.
Aye. Truce.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned to his fate but knows he's making the right decision in not attacking Karlach.

Text.Value: What was that?!
A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.
The paladins of Tyr sent me for your head. And I mean to take it.
Well, well, well. How the Blade of Frontiers has changed.
Really now? First I catch a ride out of Avernus, then I stumble into a friend. Who's the goddess of luck again? I owe her a flower.
Hang on, though - looks like you've got enough backup at your side. Not sure there's room for me.
Why should I do your dirty work?
I don't think so - you'll have to go it alone.
You want to just team up with some blood-stained killer? Because I'm fine with that.
She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.

EditorData.NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

Text.Value: Attack.
Zariel liked it so little, she sent a bunch of goons, so-called 'Paladins of Tyr', to take me back. Problem is, I'm not going.
I have good news for you. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.
I have my own problems. I don't need yours.
It's done, Karlach. By my living soul, you will forever burn.
You're the devil we've been hunting. Karlach, right?
I'm [GEN_PlayerName2_85df4a15-4d9b-4f68-0512-d104305d8dac].
Your actions in the grove were indefensible. But Karlach seeks only to drive a deeper wedge between us than already exists.

EditorData.stateContext: Karlach is kneeling in pain and on fire.

Text.Value: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.
Kill some fiends, evict a parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?
Shit.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) There's a pause, and then Wyll swears. He realises he has resigned himself to becoming a devil himself. He's upset - but he knows he did the right thing.

Text.Value: You would've died in the attempt. But - there have been enough threats today.
Tsk. That was pathetic - it really was. How said that shitty lie will be the last thing you say. Bye, fucker. You too, Blade.

EditorData.NodeContext: Right before combat

Text.Value: Aye. Your reign of horror is over, Karlach.
I may not be a devil, but I can put the Blade's reputation to work.
*Her rage and desperation seep into you. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: OSatterley: KARLACH and WYLL [REUSE] MindMeld_03_OUT animation
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

Text.Value: Please. The only devils here are you lot.
You're not the worst liar I've ever met. But you're daft as a brick if you think I'm going to believe that.
Argh! You back away first, all right? One false move, and you're dead. I've more important things to do today than kill a rat.
Trust me - when you see what I'm capable of, you won't regret it.
I'm your ticket to curing that tadpole - eventually.
All right. Let's team up.
I have good news for you, then. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.
Listen to sense, now. I don't want this to end badly for either of us.
I can see that. But look, if we take care of my little problem, we can move on to ours. The tadpole.
You served her. That's enough to damn you.
Phew, I'm getting all het up. Let's make tracks!
You've stayed my blade. Friendship? Don't push it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grim; he's going to pay a huge price for this.

Text.Value: Dirty work's the only kind I like. But there are a lot of them and just the one of me. I'll take point, and you flank 'em.
I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.
Dirty work's the only kind I like. Gets even messier the more bodies you throw at it. Think of the potential.

EditorData.NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

Text.Value: That's incredible! In that case, you ought to let me return the favour. My muscle for your aid in my battle against the powers of the arch-bitch.
I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.
So you want me to kill the people hunting you?
Fair enough. Let me try again, with a little fun thrown in. How'd you like to help me kill some evil bastards?
You want to just team up with some blood-stained killer? Because I'm fine with that.
She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.

EditorData.NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

Text.Value: Stand down, Wyll. You saw what I saw.
I'm Karlach - but you already knew that. And you are...?
One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.
*Wyll catches his breath, and his lips straighten. Sheer dread twists his face.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll catches his breath, and his face hardens. Signs of worry, fear - even sheer dread.

Text.Value: You'd like that, wouldn't you? Set down my blade and watch as you plunge yours in my heart. Not a chance. I intend to live - over your dead body.

EditorData.NodeContext: Right before a fight

Text.Value: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.
How would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?
I'd hug you if it wouldn't scorch your skin off.
You want to just team up with some blood-stained killer? Because I'm fine with that.
She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.

EditorData.NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

Text.Value: As for the Blade of Frontiers - you fashion yourself a hero, but you lie down with dogs like this. That's just pathetic.
Evidence. Proof that you're a devil, a gladiator in the archdevil Zariel's army.
Then we can work on evicting this parasite and take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?
Why don't you clear things with your leader before we team up. Send 'em my way so we can work out the particulars.
Well met, soldier. Nice to meet a friendly around here - it's been tough going so far.
I played along until I could get the fuck out of there, but devils don't like to lose their assets.
I think I told you to get the fuck out of my face, for your own good.
Listen, it was all a misunderstanding. We didn't mean for them to die.
Hang on - I said I'd help you, not team up with you long-term.
All right - welcome to the team.
Oh, I want to live. Just not in a world with you in it.

EditorData.NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

Text.Value: You did?! That's incredible! You ought to let me return the favour. We can team up - evict this parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?
This is cute. I'm still going to cave your murderous heads in, but it's nice to get a peek at the inside drama first.
Looks like you found your mark, Wyll. Let's send your devil back to the Hells.
I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.
If Wyll is wrong about you, prove it. Lay down your weapon, and we will too.
You already know I fought in the Blood War. I was good. Really good.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Vision that shows Karlach in action. Karlach speaks over the shots. (We’ll reuse this for her origin intro then)

Text.Value: *Then you're lost in visions of demonic armies as you tear through a landscape of fire and blood.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

Text.Value: You really are no devil, are you? I've... I've been deceived.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wyll sighs, almost sadly.

Text.Value: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.
Now that we're old pals, how would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?
If you value your life, you'll stand down.
What happened in the grove was a horror - one I won't ignore. But nor will I let a devil roam the Coast unchallenged.
You're right. Cut her down before she causes trouble.
That's a load of shit. But you know what? Vengeance can wait. And I have other priorities today.
Thank the gods. Thought I was going to have to take your head.

EditorData.NodeContext: Relieved Wyll is seeing sense. Calming down from her anger.

Text.Value: She's trying to trick us. Don't believe her lies.

EditorData.NodeContext: Questioning himself. He has learned the 'monster' he hunts is a victim, but he still ready to attack

Text.Value: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...

EditorData.NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

Text.Value: Let's do it.
Turns out I've got a knack for killing demons. That made me a valuable asset. Zariel - the archdevil herself - made me as her personal attack dog.
She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...

EditorData.NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

Text.Value: Wheey! Now we're talking.

EditorData.NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

Text.Value: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.
If there's one thing Zariel taught me, it's not to fuck with the top dog until it's absolutely necessary.
*The Blood War. You saw it from above as the nautiloid passed through Avernus - this woman was on the frontline.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: OSatterley: KARKLACH VISION HUM_F_Rig_DFLT_CINE_Action pose, or a Combat pose, CINE_MindMeld_Out
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

Text.Value: Wyll, do what you came here to do. End this devil.
We don't have to explain ourselves to you.
I'll catch up with you when it's time to camp, for now. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?
*Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

EditorData.stateContext: Wyll is not in attack position.

Text.Value: You know, I could've used a friend. Pity that won't be you.
Touch me and you'll regret it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Jocular in tone. It's a threat, but she's not mean-mugging. She wants a chance to explain herself before the player starts attacking.

Text.Value: When I saw an opportunity to get away, I took it. I'm finally home - or near it, anyway.
Sounds like a great plan.
You saw the truth. I never wanted to serve Zariel. I was enlisted in her army against my will. Forced to fight, and fight I did.
Try, motherfucker! See what happens!

EditorData.NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

Text.Value: Ngh...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach is crouched, head in hands, breathing heavily, surrounded by flames, burning.
EditorData.NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within

Text.Value: Those people in the grove weren't what they seemed. They were agents of evil.
I can explain. But it's a whole situation. If you'd just hear me out -

EditorData.AnimationTags: OSatterley: [REUSE] MindMeld_03 animation for KARLACH and WYLL

Text.Value: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...

EditorData.NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

Text.Value: But I can take a hint. Good luck out there. You're gonna need it.
Karlach. Advocatus diaboli. I won't be lectured on monsters by Zariel's servant.
You don't know what you're saying. You're asking me to trust a devil.
These are no natural flames - prepare to fight.
I'm not interested in making friends.
You know monsters, right? Better than anyone. Look into my eyes. Can't you see I'm not what you think?
Some paladins of Tyr want you dead. We were thinking we'd oblige them.
Truce then, hey?

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bit of uncertainty, hoping Wyll is calming down

Text.Value: Damn. After a decade in hell, I was hoping for a little company. Especially some who looked like you.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little flirty.

Text.Value: Tell me, monster - what's it like to know you're about to die?
Why should I do your dirty work?
Gods, you're stubborn. Karlach's not a devil, and you know it.
Bloody right. An honour to be chased by the Blade of Frontiers. But - agh!

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit of sarcasm. It's not an honour. Not too malicious though. She doesn't hate Wyll, just isn't impressed by him.

Text.Value: A little background, if your moral compass needs something to point at...

EditorData.NodeContext: About to tell a story

Text.Value: Get the fuck out of here. Now. Before I change my mind.
I thought you hunted devils, Wyll. Not innocents. Were all those people in the druid's grove monsters? Or is the only monster you?
Let's send them back where they came from.
Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach looks to Wyll, smiles, and stands, but she is still aflame

Text.Value: You saw her thoughts. She poses no danger to the Sword Coast.

Synopsis: Right before Karlach's recruitment Wyl recognizes her as the target Mizora gave to him. It will be up to the player to avoid the confrontation with her. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xh6W54Z2kT7NfVgxgmED_3BD2sbbs62vjFxXMYfMGgc/edit?pli=1#bookmark=id.y05ljfyxmujl
